intro: Thesium divaricatum proles glaucum, commonly known as the glaucous thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or saline environments. Its foliage is covered in a waxy, bluish-white coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions.
